page.title: 07LOCAL NEWS - JUNE 1985
page.content:
Over a 100 contestants attended the first Clay Pigeon Shoot at the White Horse pub. There was some high shooting by Mr. R. Howe, who won the trophy in the Open event, only missing two pigeons. Ken Neal retired after being the butcher in Old Buckenham for 36 years. Mr. Neal said "I only had two weeks holiday in all that time." Tom Coman has been a member of the Old and New Buckenham Royal British Legion for 36 years. Mr. Coman is 72, and lives in Fen Street, Old Buckenham.
The netball team have had a double victory. They have now won the Old Buckenham Primary School trophy twice. There are eight 10/11 year-old girls in the team. Mrs. Baker, their teacher, said "the girls have worked very hard, playing in the lunch hour."
